data.title: Cost of print
data.solution:
import sys
import math

text = input()
letterStampCost = float(input())
inkFlaskCost = float(input())
layouts = input().split()

differentStampCount = len(set(text) - {' '})
inkDropCount = 0

for c in text:
    if c != ' ':
        layout = layouts[ord(c) - ord('a')]
        inkDropCount += layout.count('f')

inkFlaskCount = math.ceil(inkDropCount / 7)

costStamps = differentStampCount * letterStampCost
costFlasks = inkFlaskCount * inkFlaskCost
totalCost = costStamps + costFlasks

print(f"{totalCost:.2f}")


# This is my shot at codesize
# 
# import math as m
# I=input
# t,s,f=eval("I(),"*3)
# l=I().split()
# print(f"{len(set(t)-{' '})*float(s)+m.ceil(sum(l[ord(c)-97].count('f')for c in t if c>' ')/7)*float(f):.2f}")
data.statement:
For an art project, Jimmy has to print out a text on paper, using ink and letter stamps.
Every letter stamp only contains one letter and is reusable.
Every character is printed using the format of a 7 segment display, and each full segment needs 1 drop of ink.
The space character doesn't need any ink.
One layout of a 7 segment character is defined by a string of characters, <<f>> for full and <<e>> for empty.
Jimmy can buy flasks of ink, but each flash only contains 7 drops of ink.

Given the layout of 7 segment characters, the text to print, the cost for one letter stamp and the cost for one flask of ink, how much will Jimmy have to pay for his art project ?

data.constraints:
[[text]] contains lowercase English letters and spaces only.
0 < [[letterStampCost]] < 100
0 < [[inkFlaskCost]] < 100
data.stubGenerator:
read text:string(255)
read letterStampCost:float
read inkFlaskCost:float
loopline 26 layout:word(7)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> A string [[text]] representing the text Jimmy has to print.
<<Line 2 :>> A float [[letterStampCost]] for the cost of one single letter stamp.
<<Line 3 :>> A float [[inkFlaskCost]] for the cost one one single ink flask.
<<Line 4 :>> A constant string {{layouts}} representing the 7 segment layouts for all 26 lowercase letters of the alphabet, separated by a space.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> The total cost Jimmy will have to pay, shown to 2 decimal places.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

For an art project, Jimmy has to print out a text on paper, using ink and letter stamps.
Every letter stamp only contains one letter and is reusable.
Every character is printed using the format of a 7 segment display, and each full segment needs 1 drop of ink.
The space character doesn't need any ink.
One layout of a 7 segment character is defined by a string of characters, f for full and e for empty.
Jimmy can buy flasks of ink, but each flash only contains 7 drops of ink.

Given the layout of 7 segment characters, the text to print, the cost for one letter stamp and the cost for one flask of ink, how much will Jimmy have to pay for his art project ?
Input
Line 1 : A string text representing the text Jimmy has to print.
Line 2 : A float letterStampCost for the cost of one single letter stamp.
Line 3 : A float inkFlaskCost for the cost one one single ink flask.
Line 4 : A constant string layouts representing the 7 segment layouts for all 26 lowercase letters of the alphabet, separated by a space.
Output
Line 1 : The total cost Jimmy will have to pay, shown to 2 decimal places.
Constraints
text contains lowercase English letters and spaces only.
0 < letterStampCost < 100
0 < inkFlaskCost < 100
Example
Input
abc
30.0
10.0
fffefff eefffff feefffe effffef feeffff feeefff ffffeff effefff effeeee efffeee eeeefff eeefffe fefefee fffeffe ffffffe ffeefff fffeeff feeeffe feffeff eeeffff efffffe eefffee efefefe effeeef efffeff ffeffef
Output
120.00
